### LCM Range Queries

<p><strong>Input format</strong></p>
<ul>
	<li>The first line of the input contains a single integer Q — the number of queries.</li>
	<li>The next Q lines contain two space-separated integers X and R for each query respectively.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Output format</strong><br>
Output Q lines, each line containing a single integer — the answer to the corresponding query.</p>
<p><strong>Constraints</strong></p>

<table>
  <thead>
    <th>Sample Input</th>
    <th>Sample Output</th>
  </thead>
  <tbody valign="top">
    <td>3<br>6 3<br>12 10<br>20 3</td>
    <td>2<br>3<br>0</td>
  </tbody>
</table>

### Explanation

<p>In the first query, the segments [1, 3] and [2, 3] satisfy the condition.<br>
In the second query, the segments [1,4], [2, 4] and [3, 4] satisfy the condition.<br>
In the third query, no segments satisfy the condition. Even though the lcm of [4,5] is 20, but the right endpoint 5 is greater than 3, so it is not counted.</p>
